etymology.description: Originally a pictogram (oven); later a phono-semantic compound: phonetic 虍 + semantic 田 (pictogram of an oven) + semantic 皿 (vessel).
etymology.interpretation: An early drawing of an oven evolved into a compound where 虍 suggests the sound, while 田 (the oven pictogram) and 皿 (a vessel) supply the meaning of a cooking/heating container. The ‘oven’ sense was later specialized into 爐/炉, while 盧 continued in names and other uses.
etymology.simplification: 盧 was simplified to 卢 by adopting a long-used handwritten/clerical variant, streamlining the complex 虍 + 田 + 皿 structure while preserving the pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 我换了一些卢布(我換了一些盧布)。
在古文里，“卢”有“黑色”的意思(在古文裡，「盧」有「黑色」的意思)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔwén lǐ, “Lú” yǒu “hēisè” de yìsi.
